r√©utilisable aussi bien pour le calcul de progression (found caches) que pour
- Progress percentages: now rounded to 1 decimal for display (DTO level)

short-circuit and recompute progress even if completed

‚Ä¢ Holds in-memory cache of cache_types, cache_sizes, cache_attributes, countries, states
‚Ä¢ Updated to use referentials_cache for normalization
‚Ä¢ Normalizes codes/names to canonical ids for attributes, types, sizes
‚Ä¢ Stores expressions with resolved *_doc_id for progress evaluation
‚Ä¢ Updated AST compiler to tolerate legacy tasks still carrying codes

This refactor removes cross-dependencies between services and guarantees
consistent code‚Üíid mapping across validation, storage, and progress evaluation.
- Removed duplicate _resolve_* helpers to avoid shadowing and unpacking errors
- Added legacy_fixup_expression to auto-convert old payloads
- Guarantees consistent TaskExpression validation across new and legacy data
‚Ä¢ Added check that any state_in rule must appear in the same AND group
‚Ä¢ Prevents ambiguous state resolution across countries
This branch required several transversal changes to ensure user_challenges
and user_challenge_tasks work correctly. Some of these belong to backend/main
(e.g. seeding), but were addressed here as they are prerequisites for this
‚Ä¢ Normalized business IDs per collection (cache_type_id, cache_size_id, cache_attribute_id)
‚Ä¢ Updated seed scripts to use consistent field names
‚Ä¢ Enriched list and detail responses with cache {id, GC} for readability
‚Ä¢ Introduced caching layer for referential collections (cache_types, cache_sizes,
cache_attributes, countries, states) loaded once at module init
‚Ä¢ Unified code/name ‚Üí id resolution (case-insensitive, hierarchical for states)
‚Ä¢ Normalization step now resolves selectors expressed by code or name
‚Ä¢ Renamed response wrapper field `items` ‚Üí `tasks` in TasksListResponse for clarity
‚Ä¢ Extended ListItem and DetailResponse with essential cache info {id, GC}
‚Ä¢ Extended AST selectors to allow code/name alongside ids for types, sizes,
‚Ä¢ Reordered routes for consistency (sync, list, batch, patch, detail)
‚Ä¢ Renamed response wrapper field `items` ‚Üí `tasks` for consistency with DTO
